metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7671 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There is a DOS attack vulnerability in Apache Traffic Server (ATS) 5.2.0 to 5.3.2, 6.0.0 to 6.2.0, and 7.0.0 with the TLS handshake. This issue can cause the server to coredump.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 7.1.2+ds-2build1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 7.1.2+ds-2build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.1.2+ds-2build1').
